column2: I have zero complaints about the service or the prices. I have been getting tire service here for the past 5 years now
column3: and compared to my experience with places like Pep Boys
column4: these guys are experienced and know what they're doing. \nAlso
column5: this is one place that I do not feel like I am being taken advantage of
column6: just because of my gender. Other auto mechanics have been notorious for capitalizing on my ignorance of cars
column7: and have sucked my bank account dry. But here
column8: my service and road coverage has all been well explained - and let up to me to decide. \nAnd they just renovated the waiting room. It looks a lot better than it did in previous years."

column1: 2   "Last summer I had an appointment to get new tires and had to wait a super long time. I also went in this week for them to fix a minor problem with a tire they put on. They \""fixed\"" it for free
column2: and the very next morning I had the same issue. I called to complain
column3: and the \""manager\"" didn't even apologize!!! So frustrated. Never going back.  They seem overpriced

column2: same starbucks fair you get anywhere else.  Sometimes the lines can get long."

column1: 4   "The food is good. Unfortunately the service is very hit or miss. The main issue seems to be with the kitchen
column2: the waiters and waitresses are often very apologetic for the long waits and it's pretty obvious that some of them avoid the tables after taking the initial order to avoid hearing complaints."

column1: 5   "Even when we didn't have a car Filene's Basement was worth the bus trip to the Waterfront. I always find something (usually I find 3-4 things and spend about $60) and better still
column2: I am always still wearing the clothes and shoes 3 months later. \n\nI kind of suspect this is the best shopping in Pittsburgh; it's much better than the usual department stores
column3: better than Marshall's and TJ Maxx and better than the Saks downtown
column4: even when it has a sale. Selection
column5: bargains AND quality.\n\nI like this Filene's better than Gabriel Brothers
column6: which are harder to get to. Gabriel Brothers are a real discount shopper's challenge and I'm afraid I didn't live in Pittsburgh long enough to develop the necessary skills . . . Filene's was still up and running in June 2007 when I left town."
